explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not chlorine and fluorine) chemically bonded only to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements).

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Calculated based on the following values: Rat LD50 value: 110mg/kg (DFGOT vol.7, 1996), 132mg/kg (DFGOT vol.7, 1996, PATTY 4th, 1994), 275mg/kg (DFGOT vol.7, 1996, PATTY 4th, 1994) and 451mg/kg (DFGOT vol.7, 1996). Since the calculated values was 141mg/kg, it was classified to category 3.

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: It was set as Category 3 based on rabbit LD50 value: 657mg/kg (DFGOT vol.7, 1996, PATTY 4th, 1994).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Based on rat LC50 (4 hours) value: 233ppm (equivalent: 0.933mg/L) (ACGIH 7 th, 2001, DFGOT vol. 7, 1996, and PATTY 4 th, 1994), the vapor pressure of 233ppm indicates steam with almost no mist. And it was classified as Category 2 by the ppm concentration standard.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: It was set as Category 2 from description that irritation was admitted in the test using the rabbit (IUCLID (2000)) and description that the skin was stimulated (ICSC (J) (1997), HSFS (1998)).

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: We classified it as Category 2A based on the descriptions that reversible inflammation and corneal opacity were acknowledged in the test applied to the eyes of the rabbits (DFGOT (7 vol. 1996) and PATTY (4th, 1994)).

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Although we found the description that the symptom of cutaneous sensitization was acknowledged in PATTY (4th, 1994) with the guinea pigs, the testing methods were unknown, therefore we presupposed we could not classify because of the insufficiency of data.

carcinogenicity.rationale: There is a negative result (NTP TR 482, 1999) in the chromosomal aberration test with the mouse marrow cells, which are the in vivo mutagenicity tests with a somatic, and in the micronucleus test with mouse erythrocyte. So it carried out the outside of Category.

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause respiratory irritation (narcotic effects, respiratory tract irritation) May cause drowsiness or dizziness (narcotic effects, respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Because of descriptions in ACGIH (7th, 2001) and Japan Society for Occupational Health recommendation (1993) referring to confirmation of drowsiness through inhalation exposure test using rats, and of description in ACGIH (7th, 2001) referring to that respiratory tracts are stimulated as an effect on humans, it was judged as Category 3 (anesthesia action, respiratory irritation)

aspiration_hazard.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
aspiration_hazard.classification: Category 1 (respiratory system), Category 2 (liver, kidney, central nervous system)
aspiration_hazard.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (respiratory system) May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (liver, kidney, central nervous system)
aspiration_hazard.rationale: We classified it as Category 1 (respiratory systems) and Category 2 (liver, kidney, central nervous system), based on the descriptions that the effects on the respiratory system were observed with the concentration of the guidance value range of Category 1 in the repeated inhalation exposure test using rat and mouse (ACGIH (7th, 2001), NTP TR 482 (1999), and PATTY (4th, 1994)), based on the description that the effects on the kidney and the liver were observed with the dosage of the guidance value range of Category 2 in the 13-week oral study using rat (NTP TR 482 (1999)), and also based on the descriptions that the effect to brain was observed with the concentration of the guidance value range of Category 2 in the inhalation exposure test using rat (ACGIH (7th, 2001), DFGOT (vol.7, 1996), and NTP TR 482 (1999)).

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 3 from 96-hour LC50=32mg/L of fishes (Fathead minnows) (HSDB, 2004).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since rapidly degrading (BOD: 78% (existing chemical safety inspections data)), and less bio-accumulative (log Kow=0.28 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)).
